title.native: 食戟のソーマ 神ノ皿
title.romaji: Shokugeki no Souma: Shin no Sara

description:
The fourth season of Shokugeki no Souma.

The ultimate Regimental Food War continues as the culinary rebels led by Souma and the members of Kyokusei square off against epicurean elitist Azami and the Toutsuki Ten. At stake – the future of dining across Japan. Because if the rebels fail, Azami intends to impose his own tastes and techniques on the entire restaurant industry!

But the fine dining control freak has made a serious mistake in threatening the futures of Souma’s friends and family, as while the rebels may seem less experienced overall, this is ultimately a clash of skill, dedication, and, most of all, taste. That may be a recipe for disaster for the seasoned veterans!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)
synonyms: ยอดนักปรุงโซมะ ภาค 4

tags.name: Educational

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

node.description:
__Doujin Circle:__ Hikakuteki Simple na Panty (比較的シンプルなパンティ)

[Blog](http://tosh2367.blog108.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Syunsaeki) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/88701)

Was an assistant of [Tadahiro Miura](https://anilist.co/staff/111985).

[Website](http://nanoripe.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanoripe_info) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nano.ripe/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCL-qIf8MciqDx0VJsQDIsHw)

__Formed:__ 1998
__Genres:__ J-POP, Rock (Pop Rock)

__Introduction:__
nano.RIPE is a two-piece Japanese pop rock band under record label Lantis (2010–), affiliated with the entertainment office Highway Star. 

__Biography:__
The band was formed in 1998 with the members Kimiko and Jun who were classmates in their prefectural high school in Chiba. They debuted as an indie band in 2008, releasing one single and three albums before they eventually made their major debut in 2010, while also signing to record label Lantis in the same year.

__Members:__
- [Kimiko](https://anilist.co/staff/169452/Kimiko) (季美子, きみコ) – vocalist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics (1998–)
- [Sasaki Jun](https://anilist.co/staff/169454/Jun-Sasaki) (佐々木淳, ササキジュン) – guitarist, chorus, in-charge of composition (1998–)

__Former Members:__
- [Abe Nobuyuki](https://twitter.com/nob_abe) (アベノブユキ) – bassist (2010–2016)
- Yuuki Aoyama (青山友樹) – drummer (2013–2016) ([deceased](https://natalie.mu/music/news/298104))
- shinn. – drummer (–2011)

__Support Members:__
- [Hiroki Takahashi](https://twitter.com/takahashi_drum) (高橋宏貴) – drummer
- [Abe Nobuyuki](https://twitter.com/nob_abe) (アベノブユキ) – bassist
- [Naoya "choku" Suzuki](https://twitter.com/choku_nary) (鈴木"choku"直也) – bassist
- [Takumi Sugama](https://twitter.com/sugamatakumi) (菅間匠) – drummer

__[Profile (Lantis)](http://www.lantis.jp/artist/stereodivefoundation/bio.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__

__Stereo Dive Foundation__ is the solo sound making project of Japanese musician [Ryuuta Iida](https://anilist.co/staff/106037), otherwise known as Ron (stylized as R・O・N)

[Twitter](https://x.com/yonetanikantoku)

Yoshitomo Yonetani was born  in Tokyo and graduated Tokyo Designer Gakuin. He is the leader of Studio 7 at Sunrise and was responsible for their super robot cult series Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar as well as Brigadoon and Betterman.

Yoshitomo was inspired working in the animation industry after having seen Mirai Shounen Conan.

He started as production assistent at Toei Douga, before moving to Shin-Ei Douga and finally Sunrise.

Other than anime director he is also a song writer for several anime series and sings anime themes under the name of ※-mai.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomos12)

He started working at Studio Deen, where he made his debut as animator in an episode of Dai Guard. After leaving Deen he became freelance and works mainly on productions for J.C.Staff but also on some titles for Bones, Gonzo and Feel. He is particularly renowned as bishoujo animator, since he tends to pay attention to detailed character appearance and traits for girls, as well as providing his characters cute and bashful gestures.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).

__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jumpaoki) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/62166972)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. He is currently the leader of the action animation department at J.C. Staff.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomos12)

He started working at Studio Deen, where he made his debut as animator in an episode of Dai Guard. After leaving Deen he became freelance and works mainly on productions for J.C.Staff but also on some titles for Bones, Gonzo and Feel. He is particularly renowned as bishoujo animator, since he tends to pay attention to detailed character appearance and traits for girls, as well as providing his characters cute and bashful gestures.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/斉藤良成)

Originating from Ashi Productions.

[Twitter](https://x.com/yonetanikantoku)

Yoshitomo Yonetani was born  in Tokyo and graduated Tokyo Designer Gakuin. He is the leader of Studio 7 at Sunrise and was responsible for their super robot cult series Yuusha Ou GaoGaiGar as well as Brigadoon and Betterman.

Yoshitomo was inspired working in the animation industry after having seen Mirai Shounen Conan.

He started as production assistent at Toei Douga, before moving to Shin-Ei Douga and finally Sunrise.

Other than anime director he is also a song writer for several anime series and sings anime themes under the name of ※-mai.
Well known for his character designs on the [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131/) series.
